section.title: Restoring a Backup with the engine-backup Command
section.para: Restoring a backup using the engine-backup command involves more steps than creating a backup does, depending on the restoration destination. For example, the engine-backup command can be used to restore backups to fresh installations of Red Hat Virtualization, on top of existing installations of Red Hat Virtualization, and using local or remote databases.

important.para: Backups can only be restored to environments of the same major release as that of the backup. For example, a backup of a Red Hat Virtualization version 4.0 environment can only be restored to another Red Hat Virtualization version 4.0 environment. To view the version of Red Hat Virtualization contained in a backup file, unpack the backup file and read the value in the version file located in the root directory of the unpacked files.
